title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis, a Bruins prospect from Latvia, scored four goals and six points in the 2025 IIHF World Championships.
Locmelis transitioned from UMass Minutemen to Boston's AHL team, recording 12 points in six Calder Cup playoff games.
Providence coach Ryan Mougenel praised Locmelis for his quick adaptation to AHL play and potential as a future Bruins player.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye for appearing 'timid' during their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Drake Maye began the game strong but struggled post-halftime, throwing an interception and failing to score further.
Questions arise about Maye managing Josh McDaniels' complex offense, despite Maye claiming his preparation hasn't changed.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, of Braintree died weeks after being struck by an e-bike in Copley Square on August 6.
Dang suffered life-threatening injuries in the crash near the Boston Public Library and was hospitalized.
The e-bike operator remained at the scene, and no charges have been filed, according to Boston police.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston will experience higher than usual tides this fall due to perigean spring tides, known as king tides.
King tides result from the moon's orbit and phases, causing ocean tides to rise two to four feet higher.
Stone Living Lab will host events at Long Wharf during high tides, with dates in September, October, November, and December.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs supports Drake Maye's ability to handle criticism and improve after debut season.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes with one touchdown in Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Stefon Diggs caught six passes for 57 yards in his Patriots debut following ACL recovery.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports between July 2021 and 2023.
A communication breakdown between DESE and DCF led to 41 months of undetected issues, leaving abuse allegations unexamined.
The audit criticized DESE for delays in special education complaint resolutions and insufficient support for LGBTQ students.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist, was fatally shot at a Utah college event while discussing gun violence.
Massachusetts politicians, including Gov. Maura Healey and Sen. Elizabeth Warren, condemned the shooting and political violence.
Authorities arrested and released a person in connection with the shooting; no suspects have been publicly identified.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez, expected Patriots starter, remains sidelined with a hamstring injury since July 28.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses miss Patriots practice with foot injuries ahead of Week 2.
Patriots face secondary challenges without Gonzalez against Dolphins' Tyreek Hill and Jaylen Waddle.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye acknowledged missing key throws in the Patriots' loss to the Raiders during the season opener.
Maye completed 30 of 46 passes for 287 yards, including a red zone touchdown to DeMario Douglas.
The Patriots struggled in the red zone, going 1-for-3, while Las Vegas converted their only opportunity.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown expressed openness to potentially playing for the Atlanta Hawks, his hometown team, in the future.
Brown remains committed to the Boston Celtics, holding a contract for four more years and leading in Tatum's absence.
Despite trade rumors, Boston's front office recently reaffirmed confidence in Brown and their reworked team lineup.
